meanings.sent1: The impetus behind her decision to start a new business was her desire for independence.
meanings.sent2: The impetus of the wind pushed the sailboat forward.
meanings.sent3: The impetus of the energetic puppy to chase its tail was truly amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music acted as the impetus that propelled him towards success.
meanings.sent5: The impetus of the falling dominoes created a mesmerizing chain reaction.

meanings.definition: The force that makes something happen or happen more quickly.
meanings.sent1: The impetus of the falling apple made Isaac Newton ponder gravity.
meanings.sent2: The impetus of the deadline pushed him to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The impetus of the squirrel to gather nuts before winter was quite amusing to observe.
meanings.sent4: The impetus of the thunderstorm accelerated the arrival of the long-awaited rain.
meanings.sent5: The impetus of the train leaving the station signaled the beginning of the journey.
